description.narrative:
The Small States Centre of Excellence is a capacity building initiative aimed at augmenting small states’ limited technical capacities through knowledge exchange and targeted training programmes. The proposed focus areas of the Centre include diplomatic training, ocean governance, natural disaster management, public debt management, broadband internet connectivity and women & enterprise.
The Small States Centre of Excellence was initially discussed at the 2013 CHOGM. A proof of concept report was carried out in 2015 and found compelling evidence for the demand of the Centre and that the Secretariat was well placed to be involved in this initiative. Subsequently, Heads of Government agreed to operationalise the Centre at the 2015 CHOGM.
On 22 September 2016, the Government of Malta and the Commonwealth Secretariat signed a Host Country Agreement to establish the Centre (attached).
The Secretariat agreed to provide seed funding of at least £100,000 per annum for programmatic, technical and advisory support. The Secretariat has since recruited a Technical Advisor to assist the Government of Malta with the operationalisation of the Centre.
